website_summaries.verdict: A user-friendly roll-on product that helps significantly reduce the severity of migraine headaches.
pros: Comes in a roll-on for easy application
Peppermint, spearmint, and lavender essential oils in a carrier oil
Goes on smoothly and won't burn your skin
Works well for migraines and tension headaches
cons: Users note that this won't get rid of your headache, but it will reduce the severity

customer_reviews.title: Science? Witchcraft? Who cares!
customer_reviews.text: I have no earthly idea why this works, but it brought me back from the dead after an 11 day headache. I found it worked better to rub it all over my hotpack, zap it in the microwave, and wrap it around the base of my neck. The aromatherapy was great, and it dulled my headache enough to restore my will to live. 5/5
customer_reviews.author: Katie B.

customer_reviews.title: I tend to get really bad ocular migraine
customer_reviews.text: I tend to get really bad ocular migraine. I get blury/blinded vision for 30 minutes and then followed by really bad headache that lasts the entire day. This product does not prevent the entire migraine symptom but it does help with the severe headache after the blinded vision. It helps with regular headaches too. NOTE: Be careful when applying. There's a lot of product that comes out from the roller. Be careful not get any of the oil in your eyes as it really burns. (I speak from personal experience)
customer_reviews.author: Mrs Pepper

customer_reviews.title: Bad experience
customer_reviews.text: I used this stick a few times and found the oil to be very heavy and greasy. The fifth time I used it, the ball for the stick popped out of the container and into my eye. Needless to say my eye burned with excruciating pain. Update: In all fairness, the supplier contacted me immediately after my review, refunded my money without asking and asked to send a new stick. I am sure that my experience, unfortunately, was a manufacturing problem.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Jacob

customer_reviews.title: Migraine Miracle!!
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is my go to fix when I feel a migraine coming on. I suffer from sinus headaches and migraines usually once or twice a week. This product I put on each temple, under my nose and on my wrists when I feel the pressure starting and it cuts the pain to a minimum. It seems to stop the worst pain before it has a chance to start. Thank you for a great product! I will buy again and again!
customer_reviews.author: Brenton1985

customer_reviews.title: Formula must have changed. Smell is not minty anymore
customer_reviews.text: Ok this is a tough review, the first time I ordered this is a couple months ago it was easily a 5 star product. I was in love. My daughter and I both used this regularly. It had an amazing minty scent that helped my headaches so much. This new stick I just got last week has a nice cooling effect, but it stinks almost like nail polish. My daughter doesn’t want to use it because of the odor. No minty smell. And it leaves your skin itching. Definitely not the same formula. So disappointing because it was so awesome
customer_reviews.author: skatemom

customer_reviews.title: Works great but can make your eyes water
customer_reviews.text: Just started using this but Holy cow, it actually works. I've only tried it on small headaches so far but I love it so much. A fair warning though, when you put it on near your temples, the menthol or something from the essential oils can irritate your eyes a little. I don't recommend applying right before driving. Wait a few minutes to get your eyes used to it. It'd like is you were to get up close and personal with some Vicks. Your eyes can water. It doesn't hurt or anything. The smell is also pretty pleasant. I will update further for more troublesome headaches as I bought this for my husband with headaches that don't respond to medication.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Worth Trying
customer_reviews.text: My oldest daughter suffers from migraines. This migraine stick has helped her. We love that it was small enough for her to stick in the front pocket of her backpack or put it in her wallet. It’s helped stop her migraines when she applies it as soon as she feels one coming on. She says it lasts about 30-45 mins before she has to reapply. We’re so grateful even for it holding them off for that short time period. It has allowed her to function better in class and although sometimes it doesn’t completely get rid of them, it has helped alleviate symptoms. Thank you for a wonderful product.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: I keep it in my purse.
customer_reviews.text: It refreshes you and may help you get distracted from a headache but I have not ever had complete relief. I love it anyway because I love to smell like peppermint. I also work in Home Health and to spare you the details lets just say I like to apply it under my nose before going into some homes!
customer_reviews.author: steelmagnolia

customer_reviews.title: People NEED TO KNOW how helpful this is!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my boyfriend that suffers from headaches and migraines that completely take him out for the day. He has used it about 5 times at this point and told me last night that people NEED TO KNOW how helpful this is. If you catch your headache early on this can get rid of it completely. For an already existing migraine, he says it takes the edge off in just a minute or two. It's amazing to see him bounce back so quick from something that usually made him sleep for hours! I definitely recommend this product and will be buying more in the future!
customer_reviews.author: Katie P

customer_reviews.title: 100% Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: I have never suffered from migraines until the last few months and since then, I have been on a hunt for headache relief. I came across this stuff as I was searching on Amazon and I absolutely love it! If I apply it to my temples and the back of my neck shortly after the signs of a headache or migraine starting, it takes care of it almost instantly or within 15 minutes. It's a perfect blend of essential oils and smells amazing! I am so happy I found this and will 100% be buying this again.
customer_reviews.author: Alyson J

customer_reviews.title: This Stuff Works!!
customer_reviews.text: Seriously, buy a stick of this and use it at the first sign of headache or migraine pain! I've suffered with headaches and migraines for over 10 years and this works within 5-10 minutes while my meds sometimes work and other times not. I've let about 9 friends use this while suffering thru headaches and migraines and they were amazed at the quick results! I love that it's all essential oils and zero chemicals! Already purchased 3 more sticks!
customer_reviews.author: Lori K

customer_reviews.title: I have migraines due to medical reasons and this doesn't ...
customer_reviews.text: I have migraines due to medical reasons and this doesn't work for me....on the hand this might work for a person who has migraines caused by other things.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Migraine
customer_reviews.text: I get both tension headaches and hormonal migraines, little helps. This little roll on does a good job alleviating the discomfort and distracting from the pain with it’s cooling tingly sensation. I find it makes me feel ok for about 45min to an hour. The one downside is the smell, it’s a little jarring for me personally since the migraines make most smells unbearable, also putting it around the temples feels good but be careful not to accidentally rub it around your eyes. Overall I give it a 4/5 stars because it’s cheap, natural and gives me more relief than most things. It’s definitely not a cure all tho.
customer_reviews.author: LD

customer_reviews.title: Worthless, bland, doesn’t work!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in early 2019, because my favorite migraine roller; Migrastick was discontinued and this is what Amazon reccomende instead. It’s very faint, barely noticeable, not worth the waste of time & money. I see there are lot’s of different migraine, headache rollers now. Don’t waste your time on this bogus watered down stuff, it doesn’t help with migraines at all. I still suffer chronic acutely or cluster migraines constantly & I got NO relief with this product!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Rebel Flower Girl

customer_reviews.title: This stuff is awesome. My 14 year old daughter has debilitating migraines ...
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is awesome. My 14 year old daughter has debilitating migraines and has to take prescription meds for them every day. We have tried other oils to try and take the edge off before she jumps right to the strong Rx. She would not use the other stuff because the smell of the other oil made her nauseous. She loves this roll on stick. She uses it and it works. Granted, it's not going to take away a heavy-hitting migraine but it will certainly take the edge off a headache and it helps her differentiate between the two. I am thankful for this product.
customer_reviews.author: jamie scarbrough

customer_reviews.title: I have suffered from migraines for 15 years. This ...
customer_reviews.text: I have suffered from migraines for 15 years. This product takes the edge off of pain if you use it when the migraine first appears; however, this is not a standalone product for me. I still need to take my meds for pain. It helps minimize the severity of the pain if used when symptoms first appear. But it will not cure the migraine itself. I will use and then take my prescription.
customer_reviews.author: pyt83c

customer_reviews.title: How? Not sure I care!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used peppermint oil for headaches before with mixed results. I am not exaggerating when I tell you that within 5 minutes of putting this on my temples my migraine didn’t hurt as much! (I had taken Excedrin migraine too, but it couldn’t have worked that quickly). If you get migraines you know you’ll try anything to cut the pain; for me, this gave me enough relief to get on with my day. I notice spearmint the most in the scent but the scent is not overpowering and fades pretty quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Grammar Police

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely wonderful!
customer_reviews.text: I don’t normally buy “alternative” medicine but I was desperate and had to try something else. This will stop your headaches and potential migraines in its tracks! I will be repurchasing this time and time again.
customer_reviews.author: Whitney C

customer_reviews.title: So far, amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I have nearly constant headaches and very frequent migraines for which I see a neurologist and nothing really works. I haven't had this long enough to use with a full blown migraine, but if I catch my headache right away, using this and the Milard therapeutic acupressure pillow (the head and neck contoured one), it is completely gone within 5 minutes!! I am not a big believer in the efficacy of holistic treatments, but decided to try this out of desperation and am so pleased that I did! May or may not work for you, but it's worth the price even if it saves you from just 1 headache!
customer_reviews.author: DJZ

customer_reviews.title: BEST MIGRAINE RELIEF!
customer_reviews.text: This little essential oil stick is a God-send! I often get migraines spurred by tension headaches that start on the back on my neck. As soon as I can feel it coming on, I roll a bunch of this on the back of my neck and I'm good to go. It's essential oils so there is a strong smell, but still very pleasant. I have a friend who suffers from dibilitating migraines and her treatment plan includes the shots now when they happen. I gave her some of this and it helped her so much to prevent them or at least calm down an already present migraine.
customer_reviews.author: kml

customer_reviews.title: Yes, it works!
customer_reviews.text: This is a miracle! I have been using this stick for 3 years and 99% of the time it cures the migraine! My husband also uses it and he likes it too. A single stick lasts a while and I like that they didn’t increase price from my first purchase 3 years ago. So this is a win-win! No nasty drugs for my liver to filter and no headache, so I can focus on my life.
customer_reviews.author: Stasy S

customer_reviews.title: Life saver
customer_reviews.text: I won't say that this will completely cure your migraine or headache, because that's too good to be true and a crock. But this definitely helps me fall asleep and feel relief when I feel one coming on at night. When it's a simple sinus headache I do feel like this eliminates it. But for those times when I have a migraine so bad that I can't function, this helps take the edge off. The smell is very pleasant and calms me and helps settle my stomach. This is definitely worth a try.
customer_reviews.author: J_schaefer

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my mom becuase shes always had headaches her whole life so I've always tried to find her remedies to avoid heavy medication. She LOVES this product. She called me one day becuase she lost the one I got her so I ordered her 3 more. 1 for her bedroom, 1 for her purse and 1 for her work. She had tears of joy that shes finally found some relief.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It definitely helps!
customer_reviews.text: First off, I like that it's a roller. It's convenient to bring anywhere and everywhere! Secondly, while it doesn't take the migraine/headache away, it makes it bearable. That's a major win in my book especially when Maxalt or a prescribed pain medication doesn't. Third, it helps lessen my migraine-related nausea and vomiting when Zofran or Meclizine doesn't help. The only reason I gave it a 4 is because I wish it relieved more pain. I know that there's just no miracle cure for chronic migraines/TMJ-related migraines, but this definitely helps. I'll be buying more!
customer_reviews.author: Kristeek K

customer_reviews.title: and loved it so much I bought another to carry around
customer_reviews.text: I bought this a couple weeks ago, brought it to work, and loved it so much I bought another to carry around. The scent is minty, but not overpowering. I put it on my temples, but put it a little too far forward that the fumes were irritating my eyes. My fault, not the product. I also put some on my forehead. I love that the most, because at first it feels like nothing, but after a few minutes, my skin begins to absorb the oils or something and my forehead gets sort of tingly cold. Not sure how or why, but this stuff helps.
customer_reviews.author: Pengy

customer_reviews.title: I was pretty skeptical, but my headaches are so bad I ...
customer_reviews.text: I was pretty skeptical, but my headaches are so bad I figured it was worth trying. While this isn't a magic cure for my migraines, when the headaches start to threaten, this can really hold things off. It also helps alleviate the pain during the migraine when I have to be at work through the headache. I now carry it with me in my purse (it's so small and lightweight), and even though I've been using it heavily for about a month, I have barely dropped the amount in the container. I'm a fan.
customer_reviews.author: luna9

customer_reviews.title: Strong smell
customer_reviews.text: Nope, this does not work. I've had chronic migraines for >50 years so I have tried many medications and non-pharmaceutical treatments. I ordered this when I was in "open-mind" mode. The smell is annoyingly strong when put on the face and temples as recommended. Many migraineurs get smell sensitivity during their migraines, so treatment with a strong smell is counter-intuitive. During non-migraine times, it smells nice so perhaps it can be a pleasant distraction if the pain and odor aversion are not too bad.
customer_reviews.author: LenaSk8

customer_reviews.title: It actually works!
customer_reviews.text: I was a bit hesitant about buying this, but I’m having a surgery soon and was instructed to stop taking aspirin by my surgeon. As someone who frequently gets migraines, that was a problem. A friend recommended this and I can honestly say... it works! My headaches are gone in about 10 minutes, and the migraines are usually gone in 15. I also have sensitive skin, so I was grateful not to have a rash after applying. You’ve found a loyal customer!
customer_reviews.author: mashers90

customer_reviews.title: It Really Works
customer_reviews.text: Was not expecting this to work.....but for my mild to medium headaches, it really gives me relief. Enough so that I don’t have to take oral medication. - *I very rarely have a migraine so I can’t speak for the effectiveness of this product in that regard. But for mild to medium (allergy related) headaches I would give this product 9 1/2 -10 stars. I will buy again! Applying to the temples I felt a menthol, cool sensation and the smell of lavender. A little oily, not bad. Sensation lasts a while for me. An hour + perhaps. Very nice
customer_reviews.author: Florida Girl

customer_reviews.title: It Works!
customer_reviews.text: A friend put me on to this. I have terrible anxiety and get migraines and also tension headaches. I've found that it helps soothe me when my anxiety ramps up. I've never tried it for an actual migraine but when I get tension headaches that don't respond to the caffeine, hot shower, pills, etc, I apply this on my temples and forehead as needed and it has helped soothe it away (or at least to a point where I could function somewhat comfortably). I have sensitive skin and it didn't make me break out either. I love this stuff.
customer_reviews.author: R. Grillo

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely GREAT😀
customer_reviews.text: Wow! I just got this and used it & within minutes I could feel a cooling sensation on my head! I have a history of migraines and nothing really works! This will go with me everywhere! Definitely recommend! UPDATE from previous review..... I’m on my 4th one! This is a must. Even without a headache...just some tension, I use it! LOVE IT!!
customer_reviews.author: A Helms

customer_reviews.title: Yes- A million times, yes.
customer_reviews.text: What a freakin life saver. I hate taking medicine because it upsets my stomach but this is GREAT. As long as I apply it at the first sign of a headache I am usually good to go. I wouldn't say its a cure all but it really eases the pain. I've let friends try it when they get headaches and they are hooked now, too.
customer_reviews.author: Julianna Kopec

customer_reviews.title: It Works!
customer_reviews.text: I bought Migrastil after my sister recommended it, and the product happened to show up on day 3 of a migraine. The directions say to use it at the first sign of a headache, but I tried it anyway. It works! The rest of my day was much better. I woke up in the middle of the night with my head hurting again, so I used the migraine stick again and 15 or 20 minutes later I was back in dreamland. Today I feel great. It may not solve your migraine, but it's definitely worth spending a few dollars to have it in your arsenal when the pain starts.
customer_reviews.author: AustenFan

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: I get headaches a couple of times a week but hate taking medicine all the time. I try to use this stuff now as soon as I feel a headache coming on. Sometimes it will help to stop the headache from forming sometimes it just lessens then pain some. Either way it helps. I now keep some at home and in my purse.
customer_reviews.author: Duchess

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t Work for Intense Migraines
customer_reviews.text: I have gotten migraines ever since I was a really little kid. Have tried so many things to help them, and when I saw this, I thought I’d try it too, although I was a bit reluctant since I don’t really believe that essential oils can help. But, I decided what the heck. Anyway, this stuff doesn’t work on migraines. It might work on minor headaches, but definitely not on migraines. It literally just made my head greased up with essential oils. And it made me smell good. I don’t recommend.
customer_reviews.author: LK

customer_reviews.title: No thank you.
customer_reviews.text: Didn't do a thing for me, glad it worked for some people, though. Actually, kind of made my headaches worse. I often find that cold is a trigger for me (cold air from the a/c in the car, wind blowing, cold shower on a hot day, etc.), and this leaves a cooling sensation on the skin. Maybe it was my imagination, but one time was enough for me to throw it in the trash. Oh, and the smell is VERY strong. If you're triggered my scents, stay away from this. The scent was for sure a factor in worsening my migraine.
customer_reviews.author: Reylynn

customer_reviews.title: No cooling affect
customer_reviews.text: I returned this product because I was used to using pure peppermint oil on my temples for headaches, and this product is combined with oil. For me personally it did not have to same affect as the pure oil. I enjoy the cooling feeling from the peppermint oil on my temples and this roller did not provide that. It sounds like it works for others but for anyone who already uses oil directly in their temples/forehead/neck, this does not provide the same affects.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: I bought it initially for my husband who suffers from dreadful sinus headaches, but he hasn't needed it since I bought it. I however woke one very early one morning with an awful headache, grabbed this, and rubbed a little on my temples, and run a stripe of it just below my hairline on the back of my neck. HALF an hour later, with NO medication... the headache was GONE.
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: Better than prescription medications
customer_reviews.text: I get severe migraines (so bad that I am on all the latest injectable meds). I’ve tried a few different herbal mixes on this site — roll ons, balms, etc. this is the ONLY one that works for all the nitnoid headaches I get — covers stesss/tension headaches, sinus headaches, etc. Often it’s the only thing that lessens or gets rid of the pain. It significantly lessens severity of migraines, better than 99% of prescription or OTC meds. I’ve purchased a few and have them stashed everywhere so I always have one nearby.
customer_reviews.author: sweetsue247

customer_reviews.title: I had just finished using a bottle of past tense doTERRA oil someone had given me that worked unbelievable even for the worst headache, but it's just so expensive so I ...
customer_reviews.text: Didn't really work for me even when I had a light headache. I had just finished using a bottle of past tense doTERRA oil someone had given me that worked unbelievable even for the worst headache, but it's just so expensive so I was hoping this would be similar. **Updated comment** didn't help much for headache but I have a lot of spine and neck problems and I did like the burning feeling it gave me, and now after trying some other oils that did absolutely nothing I gave this more stars
customer_reviews.author: KaLee

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded my expectations
customer_reviews.text: Chronic migraine sufferer of 25+ years. This thing rocks. I take 5+ preventative meds and Botox, but this little thing actually works as an abortive! Twice this week, I was able to avoid taking a Triptan! I had to use it multiple times and it paid off. I even survived the dreaded monthly hormonal migraine without a Triptan! I was so nervous i was carrying my Triptan in my pocket all day. This thing exceeded my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: JillysMama

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely overpowering smell
customer_reviews.text: I opened the package containing this and was immediately blasted by the strongest minty smell I've ever been a victim of I hadn't even removed the cap. The odor was so strong as to immediately worsen my migraine by a considerable extent. I have often been disappointed with migraine relief products but few have made them worse!
customer_reviews.author: John M. Boger

customer_reviews.title: Wow, this REALLY WORKS!
customer_reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised how well this works for my headaches! I was skeptical when my Dad recommended it to me, as its essential oils and I have tried many others before for my migraines over the past 26 years. But it truly works! I waited a while to write this review to make sure. My headaches always start in my neck. I rub some on my neck when it starts hurting and am able to prevent many of my headaches! Great stuff!
customer_reviews.author: Zoey S

customer_reviews.title: Great product!!
customer_reviews.text: This was an unexpected treat! I didnt expect alot out of this product but when you have migraines, you'll try anything. Rub this on your neck, forehead and temples. Your can feel the soothing effects within minutes. Lasts about half an hour then reapply. It's super! My daughter uses it around and under her orbital sockets for sinus relief. She loves it! Warning....do not get this in your eyes!!! Be careful around eye area!!!
customer_reviews.author: pamela kelly

customer_reviews.title: doesn't work for me
customer_reviews.text: I get pretty severe migraines and also headaches. I found no harm in trying this since not much else seems to work. I haven't found it very useful. When I put it on my temples it kind of burns my eyes, yes I'm careful to not get in my eyes. It has a very strong minty/burn to it. I usually apply to my neck and temples. I use ice hats, which doesn't go well with the mint. I'll use what I have left because why not, but I won't be purchasing another.
customer_reviews.author: Pink Springz

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic, one minute catch.
customer_reviews.text: I get migraines that radiate from my left eye the pain is unbearable. This works within a few minutes of application and helps keep them at bay long enough for my meds to kick in. It holds back the pain enough I don't get the nausea that prevents me from eating and taking my meds. One note, it does wear off so keep it with you or the migraine pain or headache will return. Other than that I wish I'd have had this 20 something years ago when I started getting migraines.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda B

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: My husband bought this for me on a whim, trying to help me with my horrible migraines. It works so well, and helps a lot with the nausea that I get. I use it when I feel a migraine come on and I can feel the effects within 5 minutes. I also will put this on my wrists and smell them during meetings when I can't necessarily put it on my face. The online downfall is that it is very strongly scented--so people will smell it. But it isn't a bad smell--it smells just like peppermints.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria Penney

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: 03/26/18 update: I arrived home from work and Susie from Migrastil had sent me a new bottle of the product, due to the originally being “leaky” when it arrived. Seriously, what great customer service and so kind! I did not request a refund or replacement - just great customer service!!! Additionally, I used the product on my 11-year old son, this weekend, due to a migraine. It’s a great product to have on hand or to carry along for headaches or anytime someone needs to soothe themselves. Original review: Product is great, but arrived and had been leaking all over the box.
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda R

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the few oils that works for me. I use it very frequently on my temples and around my scalp. I find that using it just behind the ears is not enough to dull my headaches I keep one in my bag and one by my bedside. It has a strong peppermint smell, and you don't really smell the other oils. Be careful while using it on your forehead. if it travels to your eyes it can sting, and has caused my eyelid to swell once. Still love since it has worked better and quicker than painkillers
customer_reviews.author: Flubber

customer_reviews.title: Solid home remedy to make you slightly more comfortable
customer_reviews.text: It won't cure your migraine, but the peppermint and lavender essential oils feel really good while you're in agony. I have cluster headaches, so chronic migraines for a month out of the year. I've tried a lot of remedies and this one is one of my favorites. When your body temperature heats up where you've places the roller, it activates the peppermint even more and feels like you put an ice pack on your head. This is also slightly cheaper than peppermint essential oil rollers that I have seen at the local drug stores.
customer_reviews.author: Rebeca

customer_reviews.title: It works! Wears off quicker than I’d like though.
customer_reviews.text: Well I’ll be. It works! I thought it was aromatherapy but it is not. I bought it based on reviews so I didn’t know how it’s supposed to work. I applied it before I read the idea behind it and when it started working I was thinking it was sort of like a twitch for a horse. And it is! The intense sensation of the oil really did disrupt the migraine sensation. My only complaint is that it wears off pretty quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Cat

customer_reviews.title: Great for anywhere
customer_reviews.text: I loved that it was in glass as we are trying to use less plastic but it was sturdy, I dropped it on tile and it survived. I love that it smells like the perfect stick of gum and it actually helps. I use it as a massager on the specific points that hurt on my scalp or neck. I read about it online and it reminded me of Head On. Worked well. I was glad it wasn’t like a chaptstick balm so if I leave it in the car it won’t melt.
customer_reviews.author: Eisenstaedt

customer_reviews.title: So great and it really works!
customer_reviews.text: Works so well, total life saver. I use both OTC and Prescription migraine medicine but the prescription makes me sleepy and I don't like to over-medicate on Excedrin. So this roll on stick is a nice first defense to either stop my migraine all together or get me by enough to last through a work shift (I stare at a computer all day long, so to work for an entire day with only one application is amazing!) before I can go home, take prescription and hopefully sleep it off. Would recommend 100%
customer_reviews.author: Brittany

customer_reviews.title: Don't leave home without it
customer_reviews.text: I'm not an essential oil fanatic. But i do think that this not only smells lovely but it also offers a little pain relief/distraction as i wait for stronger pain treatment [pills] to kick in. I get migraines fairly frequently, so now i hardly leave home without this product in my purse! I love that it rolls on smoothly to apply evenly and neatly. It's not messy and the scent is not overwhelming. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: J&S Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Very strong scent and it didn’t help my migraine.
customer_reviews.text: I gave this product 1 star for pain relief because it didn’t work for me. I suffer from severe migraines and I was hoping to get some relief. I got no relief. I gave it 1 star for the scent because the scent was very strong and made me get nauseous. That could also be why it didn’t relieve my migraine. I gave it 3 stars for the thickness because I don’t know what that means. Maybe it didn’t work for me because my migraines are so bad. It was worth a shot to try to get some relief. Maybe if the scent wasn’t so strong and if the applicator was metal it would have worked. I don’t know.
customer_reviews.author: Kristina Mueller

customer_reviews.title: Works for common headaches.
customer_reviews.text: I get headaches often going in and out of air conditioning, during rapid weather changes, sometimes waking up with one,etc. I also get full blown migraines on occasion that leave me incapacitated for the day. I have used the migraine stick for the many headaches that I get on a regular basis and it seems to work. I use it as soon as the headache starts and usually do not have to take any medication to alleviate the pain. I have not had a full blown migraine since using the Migraine Stick so I cannot comment on its effectiveness for that but for regular headaches it seems to work for me.
customer_reviews.author: DW

customer_reviews.title: Works well for a few minutes
customer_reviews.text: Actually works pretty well. It doesn't make the headache go away, but it is very cooling and probably just distracts from the headache. Quite impressed by the initial effects. The problem is it doesn't last very long - maybe 15 minutes or so. At the price for the quantity, you burn through a lot of it over the course of even a single headache.
customer_reviews.author: Reese Pratt

customer_reviews.title: Take anywhere
customer_reviews.text: So easy to use and carry with you. In fact, get several and have them with you, at home, or wherever is handy. This is the holy grail of migraine relief. Very little is needed. I roll on temples, by ears, above eyebrows, below cheekbones, back of neck and base of skull. I use this anytime I need. No offensive odor. Better than any medications that are prescribed or OTC. Very good with sinus congestion also.
customer_reviews.author: c.b.

customer_reviews.title: Don't know if it really works.
customer_reviews.text: Works some what? I use it when I feel a head ache coming on and it seems to just keep the headache at bay but only for a little bit. I used it at work on my lunch when I felt a headache coming and it stopped it for a little bit but once I got off work 4 hours later headache was back and by bedtime it was a full blown migraine. I don't think I would buy this again or go around telling anyone to buy it. It also burns a bit when I use it on the back of my neck like the product says to do.
customer_reviews.author: Shley

customer_reviews.title: New to having headaches
customer_reviews.text: So I suddenly started having headaches and while we are doing a bunch of testing to figure out why the drs only solution is pain meds. I'm not into taking a bunch of stuff so a friend said try this and i really like it. I have to wear a mask at work (Covid) and I actually roll it on the inside of the mask and it helps a lot and it smalls nice. Usually with in 10 min or so my headache is lessened.
customer_reviews.author: TJMay

customer_reviews.title: Hit or Miss
customer_reviews.text: I have chronic migraines bad enough and frequent enough I'll try about anything. This does work, sometimes. The key word being sometimes. For me, it works fairly infrequently but it has worked on a bad migraine, which is why I give it a chance. If desperate, it might be worth a try, might work better for you. I may try the pure peppermint oil to see if that is more consistent, per a review I saw here.
customer_reviews.author: Kat T

customer_reviews.title: Minor Decrease In Headache But...
customer_reviews.text: I had to return it. I started to feel weird and sick after using it. Cannot guarantee the product was the cause of my not feeling well but i didnt want to chance it. About a full hour after use i noticed a decrease in my headache. I am a person who uses herb teas and oils for medicinal purposes so this should not of bothered me but maybe(?) the direct application to my head wasnt good for me..?
customer_reviews.author: Ronni & Ray

customer_reviews.title: Relaxing
customer_reviews.text: My daughter suffers from bad headaches. She really likes this, it doesn’t take the full PAOK away however the scent and warming effect is very relaxing. I would def recommend to anyone suffering from headaches or just as a night relaxation ritual
customer_reviews.author: lana

customer_reviews.title: Isn't going to get rid of your migraine
customer_reviews.text: I regularly get headaches and migraines, so after seeing tons of positive reviews, I bought this product hoping it might provide some pain relief without always needing to take a pill. I should have known that topical application of some essential oils wasn't going to do much. It does smell nice and it has a tingly effect that helps distract a bit from the pain, but it is definitely *not* a cure. I usually use this while I wait for the actual medicine to kick in.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product!
customer_reviews.text: This migraine stick really helps me. I get headaches a lot and especially in the hot summer. I also get migraines. I also have constant neck pain and I use this stick on the back of my neck and also my forehead and anywhere else my headache pain is bothering me. The mint smell does not bother me. I can feel the cooking right away. It really is a great product!
customer_reviews.author: Kris m.

customer_reviews.title: Helped some
customer_reviews.text: Wouldn’t recommend for people with odor induced migraines- the scent is strong. But honestly it helps me. I went through a period of not being on any meds, rescue meds, anything for my migraines and this is all I used. Doesn’t make your eyes water like tiger balm. Cooling effect, and actually soothes the pain. Not a cure, but honestly with migraines you get desperate. Worth giving it a try.
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: You cant smell the lavender
customer_reviews.text: As other reviews have said it does not get rid of a migraine, but it is soothing & gives a little relief while waiting for meds to kick in. I love that you cant smell the lavender. I have issues getting natural solutions for migraines & headaches because most of them have lavender & floral smells are a major trigger for me. I really like the mint smell, but after it wears off it has a powder smell which I dont really like. The mint smell lasts long enough for my meds to start working so I just wash it off when I smell the powder.
customer_reviews.author: Devyn

customer_reviews.title: Did nothing for my migraines
customer_reviews.text: I did not notice a difference...the smell is really strong and the product did not help get rid of my migraines.
customer_reviews.author: xanadu228

customer_reviews.title: Chronic migraine suffer must!
customer_reviews.text: I suffer from chronic migraines and when they come on sometimes it’s too quick to take anything and let’s me honest if I took something every time my head hurt I would probably have a hole in my stomach. So I’m always looking for something more natural. It helps tremendously with the nausea and has a cooling effect almost like a temporary ice pack, sometimes if I catch a headache quick enough before it’s too bad, it kicks it almost instantly. I keep one by my bed & in my purse so it’s always handy! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Austin

customer_reviews.title: Good on the Go
customer_reviews.text: Not as effective as the white flower oil I use, but it does a good job on the go. It's essential oil based, but for a product with a "menthol" scent it is very mild so people around you aren't going to think that you just lathered up with bengay or anything. I find it easy to carry on my person and helps get me through enough until I can get home and really take care of whatever caused my migraine in the first place.
customer_reviews.author: Phoenixdown

customer_reviews.title: Did Not Work
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my girlfriend that has regular migraines that are painful for her and make her sensitive to light but it didn't do anything to help her unfortunately. She tried it multiple times and she said nothing changed and the migraine was still there. Disappointed it didn't work.
customer_reviews.author: Gonzalo Figueroa

customer_reviews.title: Consistently a life saver
customer_reviews.text: If you suffer from any type of headache, BUY THIS. It is totally worth the money. It lessens the pain, and leaves you with the ability to think/process. For me, that is the most difficult to deal with, as I often have to power through a migraine while I am either teaching high school English or corralling a four year old and an eighteen month old. This will take away the nausea and the throbbing, but you do still feel out of sorts. Better than the full migraine though, so go for it!
customer_reviews.author: Scout

customer_reviews.title: Not a fan
customer_reviews.text: Not great! I suffer from migraines and have been for years. I suffer from vestibular migraines that take on a mind of their own. I thought this would help as I am a sucker for buying Anything that I think will reduce migraine pain. Well... this wasn’t it. I considered returning it but what I did was empty some out and mix it with doterra peppermint oil. Having said that it works much better now. I won’t be ordering this again but ordering doterra peppermint oil roll on for immediate relief in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Hayds

customer_reviews.title: Works pretty well!
customer_reviews.text: This product works really well! I just put it on when I feel a migraine coming on and it makes me feel so much better because it’s cool and penetrates deep into my head. It doesn’t work all the time and I am trying a preventative vitamin called TruMigraine so hopefully that works but for when I feel a migraine coming on it’s perfect! Smells good too!
customer_reviews.author: Ellie R.

customer_reviews.title: Good but doesn’t beat 4Head
customer_reviews.text: After using this and the brand 4Head, I have to say that 4Head is much more affective and easy to use. With this roll on, it doesn’t always dispense easily and it gets everywhere if I’m laying down. The solid stick of 4Head is just more convenient. Also, 4Head is stronger and just works better. I will still continue to use Migrastil for lesser headaches. It’s not a total waste by any means. And the smell is nice.
customer_reviews.author: MeghannAugusta

customer_reviews.title: it's MAGICAL
customer_reviews.text: I've suffered from migraines for 13 years and I wish I knew about this magical little stick. It helps instantly. I would've never thought it would work but when it arrived I was on day 4 of a horrible migraine, took so many advil Tylenol and excedrin to no help as soon as i rolled this on, i felt human again. I highly recommend. I just bought 2 more even though I just got my first and used it a bunch and barely made a dent. Will forever buy and recommend this
customer_reviews.author: Casey

customer_reviews.title: Had zero relief from this product.
customer_reviews.text: No change in headaches at all. Unfortunately, I get terrible migraines maybe 1x a week. I have yet to find anything to relieve the pain. This made zero change. If anything, it made it worse. The smell is overpowering and ended up doing the opposite effect and making me nauseous.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: wow!
customer_reviews.text: I used to use something similar about 20 years ago but then they were discontinued. I was able to find this a few weeks ago. The first time I used it the pain went away within seconds. I need to buy another one so I can always have it handy since I always suffer from headaches. I highly recommend. A little goes a long way so just use a little at a time.
customer_reviews.author: Mraff

customer_reviews.title: A MUST FOR MIGRAINES
customer_reviews.text: I get migraines often and while this doesn't cure them, it tames the heck out of them. I have one of these in my purse, car, and house for use OFTEN - I will never go again without one on hand. It helps relieve the pressure and distract you from the pain. I've turned multiple friends onto this - works for headaches and head pressure too.
customer_reviews.author: jjpauli

customer_reviews.title: I've started to apologize for my overwhelming peppermint smell
customer_reviews.text: I have chronic tension headaches (I am a very anxious person) and this has completely saved my brain. I was worried about using it on my temples and forehead because I have incredibly sensitive skin, but it hasn't made me break out or anything. It's a good level of dilution to not risk skin burns, and the addition of lavender helps calm my anxiety. I use this almost every day, sometimes multiple times a day if I'm really stressed. I've found that extending it down to my traps and behind my ears makes it work even better. 6/5 would always recommend.
customer_reviews.author: E. R. Sutherland

customer_reviews.title: It actually works
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical at first. The first time I ever had a migraine, I was light sensitive and nauseas. Took excedrin for the first tome in 30+ years of life. A few months later, I had a neck strain and a moderate headache. I rolled this migraine stick on my neck, behind my ears and on my temples and within minutes, my headache went away. Would definitely recommend
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Actual magic
customer_reviews.text: I get ridiculous migraines. Take off my glasses and cry style. I’m not exactly replacing my rescue medicine with this little jar of magic, but, if I catch the warning signs in time, using this can definitely slow a migraine’s progression enough to give me time to catch it with my prescription! And provides soothing relief while I wait for the rescue medicine to work. It also does wonders for tension headaches. The one downside is, sometimes it gets in your eye. And while it is quite cooling, it’s also painful. I flush it with water and am fine, but that’s something to avoid.
customer_reviews.author: soundgirl

customer_reviews.title: Wish it would have helped...
customer_reviews.text: I’ve suffered from migraines as long as I could remember. I’ve been desperate to get away from my prescriptions for a bit and see if anything else might help or give me some relief. After reading through reviews I ordered the Migrastil stick. Unfortunately, this does literally nothing for me. It has a pleasant minty smell but that’s it. I’ve tried putting it on my temples and back of my neck and feel no different, no cooling effect and no relief whatsoever from my migraine. So disappointed but back to my Imitrex I go...
customer_reviews.author: Gavin and Beth

customer_reviews.title: It works for me.
customer_reviews.text: After buying this once, I am upset that I listened to someone else's review and wasted my money on another brand because this supposedly had things in it that didn't work or whatever. Well I went and bought that other oil and you know what it did, nothing but get my neck oily! It didn't smell like anything or stop my pain. This does and it smells nice. Sometimes you need to stick with what you know works for you.
customer_reviews.author: Glenda

customer_reviews.title: Awfully recent smell
customer_reviews.text: I have bought this product for a total of 7 times, and I LOVED it , especially when you would know your migraine symptoms and would catch it in time and would use it, it was a miracle worker for me, however my 8th time purchasing it I noticed and awful smell, not the usual minty smell, I decided to return it and bought it a 9th time and it still has the same awful smell, I don’t know what they changed but I hope they change it back because this product saved me from having to take over the counter medication.
customer_reviews.author: Paola Romero

customer_reviews.title: I have never had terrible, throw up type migraines
customer_reviews.text: I have never had terrible, throw up type migraines. But when my head starts tingling like a migraine is coming on, it seems to stop the headache. Will purchase more when I run out.
customer_reviews.author: Alexis Gilbert

customer_reviews.title: You only get half a bottle and the bottle is small to begin with
customer_reviews.text: This does seem to work but I feel like you should get a full bottle for the price. I didn’t know it would be half way full. So I’m disappointed with that but it does work.
customer_reviews.author: Agbabygirl

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: Due to Covid-19 and other work stress my migraines are becoming more frequent. Not wanting to go on prescription meds, I decided to try this. My migraines are more manageable and I can function again. I have sensitive skin and have not had any issues. The scent is more minty than lavender just refreshingly pleasant.
customer_reviews.author: Gracious

customer_reviews.title: Works amazing.
customer_reviews.text: This product works amazing. I get tension headaches quit regularly near/on my eyebrow area. I simply roll some ointment on that area and feel relief almost instantly. This compares to top brand products essential oils like DoTerra--if anything it is better. Highly recommend if you want a more natural remedy for headaches instead of over the counter medications.
customer_reviews.author: Kdaddy

customer_reviews.title: Helps me power through!
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical at first; in the summertime, I average 3 ocular migraines per week. This roll-on has allowed me to cut down on my sick leave usage by about 70%. I use it at the first sign of trouble and it helps alleviate my symptoms. It doesn't replace my prescription medication, but it does reduce how often I need to take them.
customer_reviews.author: Kara

customer_reviews.title: Great as a preventative method for headaches
customer_reviews.text: This works great. Sometimes I'll get tension headaches at work around the same time every day. It smells more like menthol but it's not too bad. It has a cold feeling after you apply it. It works but it's more of a preventative method ..like to use when you feel like your about to get a headache. It will help it you have a minor headache but I dont see it as being a replacement for a pain killer especially if you have a terrible migrane
customer_reviews.author: Trish R.

customer_reviews.title: Relaxing
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice aromatherapy tool if you are trying to lessen or prevent a headache. The roll-on is easy to apply and not messy. The peppermint and spearmint smell is strong, but I didn't smell any lavender. Advice: try to apply a little at a time because it WILL feel cold and smell strong if you apply more than a dot or small strip. No idea if it prevents headaches or migraines but I do feel relaxed when I smell the peppermint / spearmint.
customer_reviews.author: Maryann

customer_reviews.title: Love
customer_reviews.text: I love this stuff. I carry it with me at all times. I roll it on my temples and neck when I get tension headaches or migraines and it does provide some relief. The smell is nice. Just don’t get it too close to your eyes or you’ll regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Piper

customer_reviews.title: Great adjunctive nonpharmacological therapy option!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had migraines for over 20 years, and to put things into perspective... I’m 26. I’ve used all sorts of medications from preventative to abortive migraine medications. Although I can’t live without my medications, I can say that the Migrastil Roll-on stick is a great adjunctive option and would recommended it. After using it in combination with my medications, I can definitely feel the onset of relief being faster than with just meds alone! I’ll definitely purchase this product again!
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany

customer_reviews.title: This product really works!
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical if this would work. My wife gets headaches frequently and I get them on occasion. Here we are on vacation and I wake up with a huge tension headache and I rolled this on and it definitely worked! It hurt to move my head before I put this on and now I'm having no problems. The smell is great. I'm not crazy about essential oils but this is lovely.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Very helpful
customer_reviews.text: Had the opportunity to try this just after receiving, unfortunately, and it did seem to provide relief. The peppermint scent is crisp and refreshing, not thick or cloying, and did not bother the already present nausea. I did not find it as oily as other reviewers, but it is oil based. Must depend on how perfectly seated the roller ball is. For the price, it's worth a little relief.
customer_reviews.author: Tinyfeet

customer_reviews.title: Great Solution for School
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my daughter. She gets severe headaches frequently due to a disorder she has. While in school, she cannot take medications, so this was our solution. I'm happy to say that it works like a charm. She rolls it on her forehead and has relief within 5-10 minutes. We have purchased several to keep in various locations so she always has one when she needs it. This is her first line of defense when she feels a headache coming on.
customer_reviews.author: Denise D

customer_reviews.title: Feels and smells great!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my boyfriend who clenches his jaw hoping that it would help. However, he never uses it so I use it. I always have a sore neck from sleeping on my sides and stomach. I don't know if this product really relieves pain, but I rub it on my neck in the afternoons or whenever and it feels so cool and smells so good that I just feel better. So if you're the type of person that benefits from rubbing Bengay on your sore muscles and thinks it's working, you'll also benefit from this product. It just feels good.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This will be repurchased often & as gifts.
customer_reviews.text: I have used it during migraines, a panic attack, and to fall asleep, it helped anytime I used it. I apply it to my hair line on my forehead as well as the bottom of the back of my neck, my temples, my brow, and behind my ears. The scent is intoxicating like a faint mint even after all application.
customer_reviews.author: Susan S.

customer_reviews.title: Smell is too strong
customer_reviews.text: I used this a few times and I liked the way it felt but the smell I think was too strong. I'm not sure it did anything to help. in fact the last time I used it, I got a migraine almost instantly and im thinking this is what triggered it. Too scared to try it again.
customer_reviews.author: Meghan Papp

product_meta.title: Migrastil Migraine Stick ® Roll-on, 0.3-Ounce Essential Oil Aromatherapy 10ml
feature_bullets: Essential oil roll on mix. Migraines and tension headaches. 10ml Bottle
Cooling relief. Peppermint, Spearmint & Lavender therapeutic grade oils in a base of fractionated coconut oil.
Roll-On applicator. Easy to use, no mess. Apply to temples, forehead and back of neck at the first signs of a migraine.
Fits in pocket or purse, more convenient than menthol gel.

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
